meanings: to cultivate (a habit, a quality, etc.)

lessons.japanese: 家族を養うことは彼にとって多大な重荷であった。
lessons.english: Supporting his family was a great burden for him.

lessons.japanese: 家族を養うために、彼は懸命に働かなければならない。
lessons.english: He has to work hard to support his family.

lessons.japanese: ちょうど食べ物が身体を養うように、読者は精神を養う。
lessons.english: Just as food feeds the body, so reading feeds the mind.

lessons.japanese: その給料では６人家族を養うには不十分だ。
lessons.english: The pay is not adequate for a family of six.

lessons.japanese: ジョンは自分の家族を養うことができません。
ここには全家族を養うだけの十分な食料がある。
lessons.english: There is enough here to feed the whole family.

lessons.japanese: あなたの給料は家族を養うのに十分ですか。
lessons.english: Is your salary adequate to support your family?

lessons.japanese: あなたの義務は家族を養うことです。
lessons.english: Your duty is to support your family.

lessons.japanese: ６人家族を養うのは容易なことではない。
lessons.english: It's no easy matter to maintain a family of six.

lessons.japanese: 良い習慣は子供時代に養うべきである。
lessons.english: Good habits should be cultivated in childhood.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は５人の子供を養うために働かざるをえなかった。
lessons.english: She was obliged to work to support five children.

lessons.japanese: 彼を養うのは君の責任だ。
lessons.english: It is up to you to support him.

lessons.japanese: 彼は老母を養うために一生懸命働いている。
lessons.english: He works hard to support his aged mother.

lessons.japanese: 彼は老母を養うために一生懸命働いている。
lessons.english: He's working his hardest to support his aging mother.
